lines.text: [Reflecting on her life after the loss of her fiance]
"How lucky I am to have found someone and something that saying goodbye to is so damned awful."
I think the hardest time is waking up in the morning... those moments before I remember who I am, and think instead about who I was.

[Jill laboriously picks up a potato chip from a bowl on her lap]
Didn't even break. That's the hardest thing of all.
Yeah, I, I thought you were...

No, that's not enough! 'Cause I'm going to stick around here until you shape up, you understand that? I don't care if you can't ski! I don't care if you can't walk! I don't care if you crawl around like a damn lizard. You're not getting any sympathy from me.

[Jill and Audra Jo watch skiers from their wheelchairs]
What are you thinking?
